content.description: Start as for Werewolf Bar Mitzvah. Instead of topping out on the arete, get a right hand pinch on the arete, then continue moving left to a shallow, sloping crack. Get a good heel and match the crack. From the crack, find a way to cut your foot, then continue moving left to good jugs and topping out.
content.location: Starts on south face of Creek Boulder, traverses all the way around to north face.

content.description: Start same as Sting Like A Scorpion, on sloping crimps on big sloping rail. Instead of moving straight up, move left along the sloping rail, to jugs on arete, topping out as Christian's Arete.
content.location: Start on middle of downstream face, finishing on left arete.

content.description: Start low on sloping rail, on two slopers with very thin crimps. Heel hook, pull up and use lots of body tension to go straight up to a right hand brick. Bump your left up to a square sidepull, then bump it up to a small crimp on the arete. Set your feet and hop to the lip.
content.location: In middle of downstream face of Creek Boulder.

content.description: Start standing with good hands, and a high right heel hook. Move up to a powerful gaston, then to jugs and an easy topout.
content.location: Arete on southwest corner of boulder, overhanging the creek.

content.description: Large boulder in the middle of creekbed. Real nice stone with good landings.
